intro: Psychotria coussareoides, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically thick and leathery, adapted to the high-altitude environments where it thrives. Psychotria coussareoides is also known for its chemical compounds, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
